alert.note: Alert for Chaves; Curry; De Baca; Guadalupe; Harding; Quay; Roosevelt; San Miguel; Union (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 4:06PM MST until February 26 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST FOR ROOSEVELT...SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL...EASTERN DE BACA...SOUTHEASTERN HARDING...NORTHEASTERN CHAVES...QUAY...CURRY...SOUTHEASTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES... At 402 PM MST, a dust storm extended from the Pecos Valley east and northeastward to the Texas border including Clovis, Portales, Glenrio and Nara Visa. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 301 and 373. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 317 and 397. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 160 and 199. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 80 and 105. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Tucumcari, Fort Sumner, Nara Visa, Quay, Dexter, Hagerman, Texico and Logan. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms are unhealthy and have been known to lead to Valley Fever. Avoid outdoor exposure. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Chaves; Curry; De Baca; Guadalupe; Harding; Quay; Roosevelt; San Miguel; Union
